title: If you ever needed any more proof Bard is piss-pot TERRIBLE
body:
Just watch TSM vs. EDG. If you want to win your ranked, please dodge whenever Bard is picked. 

So glad stupid TSM fanboy chest-thumpers are sad after that loss. Well fucking deserved loss, not even well deserved win for EDG tbh. That loss? Was CRUSHING. Just like all of TSM's losses.

Never have I been more ashamed of being in NA. That was just embarassing. Granted that was more embarassing for EU but whatever.

"If you mess up, your team suffers."  This is not a new concept.  It's more punishing with Bard, but also more rewarding with his potential.

Bard doesn't even reward you that heavily for pulling a "god bless".

Let's talk Leona vs. Bard:

Leona hits spot on 5 man ult. Orianna can instantly follow up with ult. Sion can instantly follow up with ult. Jinx can instantly blow them up with Q. Jarvan can E Q everybody.

Bard:
Bard hits spot on 5 man ult... BUT one of his teammates (one CRUCIAL for wombo-comboing, let's say Jinx or EVEN Jarvan) is also stuck with him. Teamfight probably lost or at least very messy.

Bard hits PERFECT 5 man ult. Orianna fucks up ult timing. Jinx gets too close with Q because she screwed up Q range and is instagibbed by the enemy team once the zhonyas effect is off. Sion runs past the entire team to their backline and gets condemned by Vayne/distracted by Alistar and is too late to the party while is team is dying. Jarvan trying his damnest to make the best of the bad situation but just doesn't work out.

Leona ult is just... so much better. There's legit >NO< downside to hitting a perfect 5 man Leona ult. Impossible to fuck up that teamfight unless your team is just getting outscalled/outfarmed. So very easy to fuck up a 5 man Bard ult. Let's be fair, it's not even the Bard's fault his team didn't time their shit right, but WHY WOULD THEY NEED TO TIME IT IF LEONA IS JUST THAT MUCH BETTER.

And I'm talking like Leona is the only one that can match Bard's ult. Alistar gets the equivelant with every W Q (shorter range but much better CC). Blitz can also work. Kalista ADC can work. All these champions can troll the shit out of their team, but Bard is the ONLY one in the game who can screw up an entire teamfight even by doing his job "perfectly" (hint, you wanna ACTUALLY do your job perfectly? Don't play Bard).

Your scenario assumes WAY too much. A perfect Leona ult is damn near impossible, because people won't stack together for it. A perfect 5 man bard ult won't have an ally in it, because they wouldn't be that close to the enemy team to get caught in it.

Bard's ult is useful for a lot more than that, too. It can disable towers, delay epic monster attempts, rescue someone from a deadly spell, and more. I'm not saying Leona is bad, Bard IS strong, just in his own way.

Um, Bard ult radius is only slightly bigger than Leona's, and the delay is pretty much the same too if not bigger. 

And why in the hell would the Bard even ult the enemy team if his top laner/jungler isn't close enough to the enemy team to follow up? In the tank meta people get VERY close to each other despite being on enemy teams because of banshee's and just 6k health.

Leona ult > Bard ult. Period.

It's why you and I are only at the low Platinum level, and not challenger; we don't know what we don't know.  Get it?  We're not terrible, but there are still aspects of the game we're learning as we climb, rather than knowing everything already - even if it sometimes feels like you do.

The wise thing to do is to actually take the words and advice of people with much, much more experience than us.  That is, it's the wisest thing to do_ if we want to improve at the game_.  
The mindset that you're displaying - the _"fuck the pros, theyre not even that good, you're a kid if you believe their opinions"_ mindset - is more 'kidlike', if anything;  It's effectively rebelling against the people that are clearly extremely good at the game, the best of the best, telling us that _they're wrong_ and that _you're right_, and insulting us if we disagree with you.

I know for a fact that, despite being the most bashed-upon teammates of their teams, what they say is very valuable because their gameplay is just downright GOOD. There's a reason they're on teams that are consistently 1st/2nd place.

Pretty sure 90% of pros think it's subpar since they don't actually bust it out on stage (except for our rather "adventurous" supports today).  So even if I did respect qtpie's opinion, I'd respect the international best's opinions a hell lot more.
